noun.description: A continuing sound, especially of a person's voice, that is unchanging in pitch and without intonation.
examples: he sat and answered the questions in a monotone

adjective.description: (of a voice or other sound) unchanging in pitch; without intonation or expressiveness.
examples: his monotone reading of the two-hour report

origin: Mid 17th century: from modern Latin monotonus, from late Greek monotonos.
